alert.note: Alert for Eastern Roosevelt; Richland; Western Roosevelt (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 2:26PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Roosevelt and northern Richland Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 226 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles north of Brockton, or 18 miles northeast of Poplar, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Culbertson, Froid, Mccabe and Fort Kipp. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern Montana.
